title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: UAE signs $1.8 billion deal with US firm to boost global critical minerals supply
Safran lifts forecast after strong Q3
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- **Safran** lifts its full-year revenue growth forecast to *11–13%* after a strong third quarter, led by its jet-engine division.
- Q3 revenue rose *18.3%* to *€7.85 billion*, with propulsion up *25.6%* and services up *21.1%*, aided by LEAP shipments.
- It also raised targets for operating income to *€5.1–5.2 billion* and free cash flow to *€3.5–3.7 billion*, with LEAP deliveries expected to grow by more than *20%*.

items.title: Xiaomi cites memory-chip price rise hitting smartphone costs
items.summary:
- *Xiaomi* says surging *memory-chip* prices have raised smartphone production costs.
- The *Redmi K90* base price is 2,599 yuan (12 GB/256 GB), up from the K80's 2,499 yuan, with a temporary 300-yuan cut on the 12/512 model.
- A global rush for *AI chips* is tightening supply and boosting *NAND/DRAM* costs, lifting profits for *Samsung* and *SK Hynix*.

items.title: Chinese phone makers expand India operations despite thin margins
Colab Platforms to enter semiconductor OSAT sector
items.summary:
- Colab Platforms will form Colab Semiconductor Pvt Ltd to enter India's *semiconductor manufacturing* and *OSAT* markets, expanding beyond its AI, blockchain, e-sports, fintech, and drones ventures.
- The move aligns with India's forecasted growth in the sector from USD 52B in 2024-25 to USD 108B by 2030, a *15% CAGR*, per MD Puneet Singh.
- The expansion is expected to unlock multi-decade growth, strengthen India's tech sovereignty, and create enterprise value as the ecosystem evolves, following the launch of Colab Intelligence Private Limited for AI operations.

items.title: NTPC, EIL sign coal-to-gas facility deal
items.summary:
- NTPC and **EIL** signed an agreement to develop a coal-to-SNG facility to enable flexible power generation.
- The facility will use *high-ash domestic coal* from NTPC's captive mines to fuel gas-based power stations and in-situ generation.
- NTPC's R&D arm will lead the initiative under *Greening the Coal*, emphasising **cleaner coal technologies** and energy diversification.

items.title: Reliance races to get battery gear orders out of China ahead of export curbs
SISA, BMS unveil CoE to boost future-ready talent
items.summary:
- BMSIT&M and SISA launch a Centre of Excellence to train *future-ready talent* in cybersecurity and emerging tech.
- The CoE bridges academia and industry, helping students tackle *AI* and *quantum*-driven threats with a focus on *prediction and preparedness*.
- The initiative aims to empower engineers to anticipate evolving threats, supporting India’s digital future and *Atmanirbhar Bharat*.
keywords: BMS Institute of Technology and Management

items.title: Turkiye in talks with Qatar, Oman to buy Eurofighter jets
items.summary:
- Turkiye is in talks with Qatar and Oman to buy *Eurofighter Typhoon* jets as a stopgap ahead of **KAAN**'s readiness.
- *Erdogan* said talks are progressing positively during a Gulf tour with no details released.
- The plan foresees a transitional fleet: 40 *Eurofighter Typhoon* jets, 40 *F-16s* and 40 *F-35s*, until **KAAN** enters service around 2028.

items.title: GX Group to invest ₹500 cr to set up photonics modules
items.summary:
- **GX Group** to invest ₹500 crore to set up photonics modules and a chip arm in India via GX Quantum Photonics Pvt Ltd, with manufacturing in Bhiwadi and R&D expansion in Chennai.
- The venture will produce about *3 million chips annually*, create 300+ direct jobs, and begin operations by *Q1 FY27* with domestic priority and potential international forays (US/Europe).
- It collaborates with *SMART Photonics* for InP-based PICs, focuses on **Photonics modules** for **5G/6G** and quantum communications, and targets a ~*USD 50 billion* addressable market in India.

items.title: Premier Energies to acquire KSolare Energy for ₹170 cr
items.summary:
- Premier Energies will acquire the entire ownership of *KSolare Energy*, forming a 51:49 JV with *Syrma SGS Technology* for ₹170 crore. 
- *KSolare Energy* runs a Pune manufacturing facility producing solar inverters (on-grid, off-grid, and hybrid) with a capacity of 500,000 units per year for the residential market. 
- The JV plans a brownfield expansion in Pune to scale up to 1 million inverters annually and expand in the domestic rooftop solar segment under government schemes like PM Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana.
keywords: PM Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana

items.title: AI demand lifts Taiwan industrial output in Sept
items.summary:
- Taiwan's total industrial production rose 15.48% YoY in September, with the manufacturing index at a record high, driven by *AI demand*. 
- In the information and electronics sector, output surged as *AI* and high‑performance computing boosted demand, with ICs and electronics products up over 26%. 
- Some traditional industries were pressured by weak global demand, with auto parts and base metals down.

items.title: Toshiba debuts 24V SCiB for auto, marine, heavy equipment
items.summary:
- Toshiba launches the SCiB *24V* battery pack (P25H20-3) for auto, marine, and heavy equipment, featuring 20Ah-HP cells and a configurable 2S/6P layout that can replace *lead-acid* in many applications. 
- The SCiB 24V is already deployed in Yamaha Motor's electric boat, the e-Float Terrace, in Yokohama, helping decarbonise marine transport. 
- Toshiba touts high safety, rapid charging, low-temperature performance, and IPX9K/IPX7 waterproofing, underscoring lithium-ion's growing role in mobility and heavy equipment.

items.title: Haryana to become electronics manufacturing hub
items.author: IANS
items.summary:
- *Haryana* aims to become a leading electronics manufacturing hub by leveraging the ECMS and an upcoming *ESDM Policy* with incentives.
- Chief Secretary *Anurag Rastogi* chaired a high‑level meeting to boost investments and speed up the ecosystem, including the planned Electronics Manufacturing Cluster at IMT Sohna.
- *Haryana* accounts for about *2.9%* of India's electronics exports and supports ~1.3 million jobs, with policy support and potential top‑up incentives to raise growth.

items.title: Singapore firms scout SA for manufacturing and trade
items.summary:
- *Singaporean companies* are visiting *South Africa* to explore partnerships in *manufacturing*, logistics, and consumer goods as bilateral trade has nearly doubled in four years.
- The mission, led by *Enterprise Singapore* and part of its *Scale-Up Programme*, aims to connect participating firms with South African counterparts across sectors.
- *Manufacturing*, *agri-processing*, and *logistics* are priority sectors, with trade reaching *$1.4B* in 2024, nearly double 2020.

items.title: Chakr Innovation secures $23 million to tackle air pollution with aluminium-air batteries
Crompton Greaves bags ₹445-crore solar rooftop order in Andhra Pradesh
Godrej Enterprises arm launches 48V Li-ion pallet truck
items.summary:
- *Godrej Enterprises* has launched the GEPT 20, India's first **48V Li-ion** powered *electric hand pallet truck*, to boost mobility in warehousing.
- It delivers up to three times the productivity of conventional trucks with features like fast lifting, long runtime, and precise control.
- The unit runs over four hours per charge, can handle up to two tonnes, and includes a turtle-speed mode for safe movement in confined or high-traffic areas.

items.title: Volkswagen: production secure for coming week
items.summary:
- Volkswagen's *German sites* are set to operate normally next week as it shields its *supply chains* from the **Nexperia** chip-dispute. 
- However, *short-term impacts* on the production network cannot be ruled out, as VW looks at *alternative sourcing* and talks with potential suppliers. 
- Production at the Wolfsburg plant is secured through Oct 30, with the following day a public holiday in parts of Germany where its Wolfsburg and Zwickau plants are based.

items.title: Intel beats Q3 profit estimates on cost cuts and investments
items.summary:
- Intel beat September-quarter profit estimates as *cost-cutting* and asset divestitures improved margins to 40% and EPS of *23 cents*, well above *1 cent* expected.
- Investments from **Nvidia** and **SoftBank** and a rare **U.S. government stake** provide a lifeline as Intel regains footing in AI and other markets.
- For Q4, revenue is guided at $12.8B–$13.8B (midpoint $13.3B), roughly in line with consensus of about $13.37B.

items.title: India won't rush into a trade deal: Piyush Goyal
items.summary:
- *India* will not rush into a trade deal; it's aiming for a **fair, long-term** agreement rather than quick concessions.
- Trade deals are about more than tariffs; they rely on *trust* and relationships, with India negotiating with the **US** and the **EU** on market access, standards, and origin rules.
- Goyal highlighted ongoing talks with the **US** and the **EU**, with Germany in Berlin, and said progress is being made toward a fair outcome while addressing energy security concerns over Russian oil.

items.title: Apple begins shipping AI servers from Houston factory
items.summary:
- Apple has begun shipping AI servers built at its *Houston factory*, part of a broader push to invest **$600 billion** in U.S. manufacturing.
- The servers include chips that enable AI features while upholding Apple's *privacy* safeguards on iPhone and Mac.
- Apple plans to expand the *Houston factory* and deploy more **data centers** across the U.S. next year.

items.title: From coastal breeze to global reach: VOC Port leads India's windmill blade exports
The strategic case of boosting India’s domestic aluminium capacity
NOVA partners with Tata Elxsi to co-develop Kavach 4.0
Abunayyan Holding, Nextracker form JV to boost solar manufacturing in Saudi Arabia
NIT Karnataka to develop rare earth free electric vehicle motors
items.summary:
- The Centre for System Design (CSD) at *NITK Surathkal* will develop **rare-earth-free** magnet-electric traction motors (switched reluctance and synchronous reluctance) under the **MAHA‑EV** mission, funded ₹10.3 crore by ANRF.
- NITK leads with IIT Madras, IIT Hyderabad and CDAC Thiruvananthapuram, as one of seven Electric Mobility Nodes focusing on EV tech (TV‑I/II/III).
- The initiative aims to accelerate *India's sustainable mobility* by deploying *indigenous motor tech* and reducing dependence on rare earth magnets.

items.title: India private sector growth slips to 5-month low in Oct
items.summary:
- The *HSBC/PMI* for India showed the *composite index* at 59.9 in October, signaling continued expansion but a five-month low.
- Services activity slowed while manufacturing recovered, with *new orders* expanding at their weakest since May and *exports* softening.
- Cost pressures eased after GST cuts, but firms largely did not cut prices, and *optimism* weakened due to rising competition and uncertain demand.

items.title: Xiaomi says memory-chip prices push up smartphone costs
items.summary:
- *Memory-chip costs* are being transferred to smartphone pricing, and Xiaomi warns the pressure could intensify.
- The Redmi K90 base price starts at 2,599 yuan, up from 2,499 yuan for the K80, with a 300 yuan cut planned for the 12 GB/512 GB model in the first month.
- A global surge in AI-chip demand has tightened supply of conventional chips, boosting NAND and DRAM makers and raising handset costs.

items.title: L&T bags big orders in Minerals & Metals
items.summary:
- L&T's Minerals & Metals arm bagged multiple large orders across India, strengthening its presence in *aluminium*, *steel*, and *mining* sectors.
- It secured Hindalco’s project for a 180 KTPA aluminium smelter and Gas Treatment Centre in Odisha, with contracts in the 2,500–5,000 crore range.
- In steel, L&T M&M won Tata Steel's 1 MTPA Coke Oven Battery 6 A/B, plus several orders for mining and material-handling equipment, underscoring *engineering excellence* and strong execution.

items.title: Steel prices hit 5-year low; weak trend likely to persist in near term: BigMint
Trump tariffs to dent India leather industry revenue 10-12% current fiscal: Crisil
Galderma raises outlook after sales beat
items.summary:
- **Q3 US net sales** grew 17.5% to $1.29B, beating the $1.24B consensus.
- Full-year net sales guidance lifted to about **17.0%–17.7%** at constant currency, plus **US manufacturing** spend over $650M through 2030.
- CEO **Flemming Ornskov** cites strong **US growth**, Europe strength, and a forecast **core EBITDA margin** of **23.1%–23.6%** at constant currency amid tariff dynamics.

items.title: Japan's factory activity hits 19-month-low in October
Critical mineral issue: Framework for waste recycling
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary:
- The Union Mines Ministry said the critical mineral recycling framework will formalise collection under the *Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR)* rules to boost feedstock for local recyclers.
- The ₹1,500 crore incentive scheme aims to bring more players, including dismantlers and shredders, into the formal system, despite concerns over informal feedstock, tech gaps, and cap limits on sops.
- E-waste, *spent LIBs* and catalytic converters are categorised as feedstock; imports may rise as tariff lines are adjusted, with 4–5 year growth expected in feedstock availability.

items.title: Odisha CM, Vedanta unveil ₹1L investment roadmap
items.summary:
- Vedanta commits to invest **₹1 lakh crore** in Odisha, creating **over 1 lakh jobs** and boosting the state's industrial growth.
- The plan includes a **₹2,000 crore ferro alloys plant** in Keonjhar and two aluminium parks to strengthen the value chain and attract MSMEs.
- Chief Minister described it as a *game-changer* toward Odisha's **$500 billion economy target by 2036**, with Vedanta as a long-term partner and a call for youth and new entrepreneurs.

items.title: Cipla to sell Lilly's weight-loss drug in India
items.author: Rica Bhattacharyya, ET Bureau
items.summary: - Lilly ties up with Cipla to market tirzepatide in India under the new brand **Yurpeak**, broadening access beyond major urban centres.\n- Yurpeak and Lilly’s existing brand **Mounjaro** will be priced the same, with Yurpeak available in a six-dose KwikPen (2.5, 5, 7.5, 10, 12.5, 15 mg) for once-weekly administration.\n- The deal marks Cipla’s entry into India’s ₹752 crore anti-obesity market, with a hybrid strategy leveraging Cipla’s network and partnerships to expand access, alongside rivals like Novo Nordisk’s **Wegovy**.

items.title: Unilever's India business to be stronger in medium term: CEO Fernando Fernandez
TP-Link dials up three states for ₹100 crore factory
items.summary:
- TP-Link India plans its biggest factory globally in India, with an investment of over *₹100 crore* across **three states** as part of a five-year expansion. 
- Initially the plant will serve the *domestic market* for two years, after which it will export to West Asia, Africa and Turkey, aiming to localize **96-97%** of products in India. 
- Beyond consumer routers, TP-Link is aiming at enterprise growth with **AI-enabled solutions** such as *ANPR* and people counting.

items.title: Starlink to establish nine gateway stations across India ahead of satellite services launch
112 drug samples fail quality tests in September, 1 found spurious: Govt
Maharashtra's Mihan SEZ welcomes Solar Defence and Aerospace Ltd with major drone manufacturing investment
Japan factory PMI hits 19-month low in Oct
items.summary:
- *Japan’s factory PMI* fell to 48.3 in October, the lowest since March 2024, signaling a 19-month contraction.
- *New orders* declined faster, while export orders fell, though October’s export drop was the slowest since March and exports rose in September.
- *Services and composite PMIs* showed a mixed picture (services 52.4, composite 50.9) with rising cost pressures across inputs and outputs.

items.title: LONGi to source ₹7,000cr modules from Inox Solar
items.author: Shilpa Samant, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- **LONGi** will source 5 GW of solar modules from *Inox Solar* for the Indian market under a ₹7,000 crore deal over three years. 
- *Inox Solar* is expanding capacity with a Bavla plant of 1.2 GW (to 3 GW) and a 4.8 GW cell/module facility in Dhenkanal, with an IPO planned for Inox Clean Energy. 
- The arrangement supports domestic content and India’s growing module/cell capacity amid import duties.

items.title: GST reduces on notebooks but expect no relief on prices
Defence Ministry nod for ₹79,000 crore hardware buy
items.author: IANS
items.summary:
- **₹79,000 crore** defence package approved for Army, Navy and Air Force.
- Army: NAMIS, GBMES and High Mobility Vehicles to boost logistics.
- Navy & Air Force: LPDs, NSG, ALWT, EO/IRST and smart ammo; AoN for *CLRTS/DS* enabling autonomous ops.

items.title: Govt launches training modules for effective management of chemical emergencies
Cochin Shipyard delivers Mahe to Indian Navy
items.summary:
- *Cochin Shipyard Limited* delivered *Mahe*, the first in a series of eight *ASW SWC* vessels, to the *Indian Navy*, underscoring India's push for *self-reliant* defence manufacturing.
- The 78‑metre craft uses a diesel‑engine–waterjet propulsion system to boost speed, agility and shallow‑water capabilities for roles such as underwater surveillance and search & rescue.
- With **over 90% indigenous content**, the project exemplifies the government’s *Make in India* drive, and the remaining seven ships in the series are under construction for phased delivery.

items.title: From $250 million to $2 billion: India’s role in global aerospace supply chain grows
Premier Energies buys 51% stake in Transcon
items.summary:
- *Premier Energies* is expanding into transformer manufacturing by acquiring a 51% stake in *Transcon Industries* for ₹500.3 crore.
- This move aims to build a fully integrated *clean energy solutions provider*, serving renewable power, DISCOMs and industrial customers with higher-value transformers.
- The deal broadens *downstream integration* into transformers, solar/storage/inverters, strengthening the energy value chain in India.
